reviewText: ...but if you're looking for a broader documentary,  find another DVD.

I use these as a resource to reinforce learning we have already done in class. They are about 30 minutes long, but give great detail. If your purchase this I have created movie guides for this and the other videos in the series and would be willing to share.
Excellent - concise view of key events and personalities during the Progressive Era. Recommend for educators (can easily be used as an accurate review of the period).
The narrator speaks entirely too quickly  I used this for a community college class, and I had to pause the video frequently to let students catch up with the narration in their notes.
I found this presentation reminding me of a high school history teacher racing through a class just to be done with it. I was hoping for a  more in depth presentation.

I used it at the end of my "Gilded Age" unit with my high school students, as a review for a unit test, and we found it very helpful.  The scenes portrayed on film in this particular episode are not entirely accurate with the subject matter that is being discussed by the narrator.  However, it did not distract from making it a viable review tool.
I AM DELIGHTED WITH ALL OF MY "JUST THE FACTS" MATERIALS. GREAT FOR MY OWN LEARNING!
I purchased this to use as a media presentation for my American History class at the Community College. It's a good film. Lots of vintage photos and footage. A good supplement to my lectures.
